data.title: Don't judge a book by it's cover!
data.text: After a long night out in Nashua, we ended up driving around town until we finally found a decent pizza shop. Soprano's isn't the most aesthetically pleasing restaurant, with the interior of the restaurant feeling a bit dirty at times. The pizza here, however, was delicious, and the cheese slices were huge for the price! I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if you're in the area and you need a quick bite, Soprano's is a good place for just that.

data.title: Delicious pizza, real neapolitan in NH!
data.text: We ordered delivery during a soccer tournament. I read online reviews that Soprano's was the best pizza in NH. I figured like most vacation spots we might be in for the best of the worst. I was blown away. Best pizza I have had outside of Boston's North End. Great crust, delicious sauce, great toppings. Get the Soprano.

data.title: Cold thin pizza
data.text:
My 27 yoa son lives in Nashua and he wanted to try this place so we ordered a pepperoni pizza. We were told it would take 20 minutes. When we arrived our order was ready and sitting on top of the oven. We drove 3 miles home. When we opened the box 2 of the pieces had slid on top of the rest of the pizza. The pizza even "looked" cold. It was barely warm. We didn't need to worry (at all) about burning the roof of our mouth with a fresh hot pizza. If I didn't know better I'd have assumed the pizza was over an hour old. Maybe they had a cancelled or no-show order and just placed this pie back on the top of the oven to warm it up. The sauce, cheese and crust were all cold.

The bleu cheese sauce with the fried buffalo chicken tenders was really like bleu cheese mixed into mayo. Horrible. They are a pass.

Very disappointing--this place is probably named Soprano's because it's a front for something else because they sure can't cook pizza.

data.title: Not so good
data.text:
This place leaves a lot to be desired especially when it comes to sandwiches the main ingredient bread is not quite still but very close.

There are other places nearby that have great sandwiches and outstanding pizza look before you leap. Also the staff is not very friendly it's like you're the enemy causing them to work and when they bring the food it's like here you go good luck! Having said that I will be back but only because they sell pizza by the slice.

data.title: Fresh food, long wait
data.text:
The food is delicious and you can tell it's made fresh.
I've had their pizza, subs, wings, and fries and they all tested really good!

The only reason I am giving them a 4 star is because every time I order, it takes over 40 minutes to deliver. As a result, the food gets cold and soggy, and I end up having to heat everything up. 

I would recommend them and probably will order again,but hope for a quicker delivery.

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: I've only had their pizza, it was good, the crust was perfectly cooked. I am new to the area and have had terrible pizza in Nashua, if this were back in my home town I'd give it 3 stars but for Nashua it's the best I've had so far.

data.title: Superb!
data.text: I recently moved to the Nashua area and have been in a desperate search for good pizza I searched high and long tried many without any luck untill I stumbled on Sopranos in downtown Nashua. This pizza is superb it rivals many Boston establishments and the prices are reasonable but most of all the pizza is out of bounds. The Pizza superb fresh cheese homemade sauce brick oven is to die for try it once you'll be back again and again. There is none better in the Nashua area that I have found.

data.title: Mixed review
data.text: Got a menu in the mail. We Ordered a bunch of food. Some good/some not so much. Onion rings were terrific , pizza was thin crust but not crispy crust as expected and had much too sweet a sauce. Not to mention both pizzas had been tilted by delivery and half the toppings had slid over to one side. Wings were supposed to be marinated baked and fried according to menu, yet mine were undercooked and not that much flavor. Husband said buffalo were ok. Teriyaki sub had a nice soft roll, but very little cheese and flavor was eh .. Overall reviews were mixed. Oh also not free delivery which came as a surprise cost as every place in Nashua is free delivery. For us not again. 7 star has better wings and pizza.

data.title: New, favorite delivery spot
data.text:
Menu arrived in the mail, so we decided to try out Sopranos on Oct 11th. Ordered wings, a sausage/peppers sub and buffalo chicken wrap. We were pleasantly surprised!  The wings were great as well as the sandwiches. 

Next day we were having a bday party for our son and ordered again. Cheese pizza, Alfredo chicken pizza, chicken fingers and mozzarella sticks. Everything was fresh and homemade - including the chicken fingers and fried cheese. Amazing and what a difference. Definitely recommend.

data.title: Ok
data.text:
Food was good, wings were great with a little spicy kick. Pizza crust perfectly cooked and tasted fresh- unlike many pre-made pizzas that are so common around here. Chicken salad had tons of chicken- fresh lettuce and perfect amount of dressing.
Delivery was on time. 
Only annoyance was that they forgot to take my coupon. That was the only reason I ordered here, and that's scummy to me to do to someone. Delivery driver said "use it next time".
There's great food elsewhere, I don't like people taking more than what was quoted.
